member.summary: Gets current text cursor (caret) rectangle in screen coordinates. Returns the control that contains it. If there is no text cursor or cannot get it (eg it is not a standard text cursor), gets mouse pointer coodinates and returns Wnd0.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Input.Keys_
member.summary: Keys and modifiers that are missing in enumeration.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Input.Keys_.Windows
member.summary: Modifier key Windows (flag). Can be used like Keys.Shift etc.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Input.Keys_.NumEnter
member.summary: Numpad Enter key.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Input._KeyFunc.Plus
member.summary: + operator. Presses the key and does not release. These keys are auto-released after next key or (keys) that is not followed by +. Also after next mouse click. Example: "Ctrl+Shift+A ...". Example: "Alt+(F O) ...". Example: "Ctrl+" ... Mouse.Click() //Ctrl auto-released here.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Input._KeyFunc.Star
member.summary: * operator. 1. Repeats the preceding key. Example: "Tab*10" //press Tab 10 times. 2. Just presses (without releasing) or just releases. Example: "Ctrl*down" ... "Ctrl*up".

member.name: P:Catkeys.Input._KeyFunc.ParenStart
member.summary: ( operator. 1. Encloses function arguments. Example: WAIT(0.5). 2. Turns off auto-releasing keys pressed with operator +, until ")". Example: "Alt+(F O) ...". Example: "Ctrl+(" ... Mouse.Click(); Mouse.Click(); ... ")" //Ctrl released here.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Input._KeyFunc.ParenEnd
member.summary: ) operator. Releases keys pressed with operator +, when auto-releasing was turned off with operator (. See .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Input._KeyFunc.VK
member.summary: VK(vk, sc=0, ext=0) Sends key specified as virtual-key code and/or scan code. vk - virtual-key code. sc - optional scan code. ext - optional flags: 1 extended key.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Input._KeyFunc.CHAR
member.summary: CHAR(c) Sends a character using VK_PACKET. c - Unicode character code.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Input._KeyFunc.SLEEP
member.summary: SLEEP(t) Waits. t - number of milliseconds, eg 100.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Input.Misc
member.summary: Less-often used functions related to keyboard input.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Input.Misc.ReadKeyString(System.String)
member.summary: Converts keys string to List.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Input.Misc.ReadHotkeyString(System.String,System.Windows.Forms.Keys@)
member.summary: Converts hotkey string to Keys. For example, if s is "Ctrl+Left", hotkey will be Keys.Left with modifier flag Keys.Control. Must be single non-modifier key, preceded by zero or more of modifier keys Ctrl, Shift, Alt, Win, all joined with +. Named keys must match case. Keys A-Z don't have to match case. Valid hotkey examples: "A", "a", "7", "F12", ".", "End", "Ctrl+D", "Ctrl+Alt+Shift+Win+Left", " Ctrl + U ". Invalid hotkey examples: null, "", "A+B", "Ctrl+A+K", "A+Ctrl", "Ctrl+Shift", "Ctrl+", "NoSuchKey", "end". Returns false if the string is invalid.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Input.Misc._KeyToModifier(System.Windows.Forms.Keys)
member.summary: If k is Shift, Control, Alt or Win (including left and right), returns it as modifier flag, eg Keys.Shift from Keys.ShiftKey. Else returns 0.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Input.Misc._KeynameToKey(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts part of string to Keys. The string should contain single key name, eg "Esc", "A", "=". Returns 0 if invalid key name.

member.summary: This overload has different parameter types.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Api.strtoi(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts part of string to int. Returns the int value. Returns 0 if the string is null, "" or does not begin with a number; then numberEndIndex will be = startIndex. Returns int.MaxValue or int.MinValue if the value is not in int range; then numberEndIndex will also include all number characters that follow the valid part.
member.param: String.
Offset in string where to start parsing.
Receives offset in string where the number part ends.

If 0, parses the string as hexadecimal number if begins with "0x", as octal if begins with "0", else as decimal. Else it can be 2 to 36. Examples: 10 - parse as decimal (don't support "0x" etc); 16 - as hexadecimal (eg returns 26 if string is "1A" or "0x1A"); 2 - as binary (eg returns 5 if string is "101").
member.exception: startIndex is invalid.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Api.strtoui(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32@,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts part of string to uint. Returns the uint value. Returns 0 if the string is null, "" or does not begin with a number; then numberEndIndex will be = startIndex. Returns uint.MaxValue (0xffffffff) or uint.MinValue (0) if the value is not in uint range; then numberEndIndex will also include all number characters that follow the valid part. Supports negative number values -1 to -int.MaxValue, for example converts string "-1" to 0xffffffff.
member.param: String.
Offset in string where to start parsing.
Receives offset in string where the number part ends.

If 0, parses the string as hexadecimal number if begins with "0x", as octal if begins with "0", else as decimal. Else it can be 2 to 36. Examples: 10 - parse as decimal (don't support "0x" etc); 16 - as hexadecimal (eg returns 26 if string is "1A" or "0x1A"); 2 - as binary (eg returns 5 if string is "101").
member.exception: startIndex is invalid.

Returns long.MaxValue or long.MinValue if the value is not in long range; then numberEndIndex will also include all number characters that follow the valid part.
member.param: String.
Offset in string where to start parsing.
Receives offset in string where the number part ends.

If 0, parses the string as hexadecimal number if begins with "0x", as octal if begins with "0", else as decimal. Else it can be 2 to 36. member.name: T:Catkeys.Native
member.summary: Windows API types and constants used with public functions (parameters etc) of this library. Also several helper functions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Native.ClearError
member.summary: Calls API SetLastError(0), which clears the Windows API error code of this thread. Need it before calling some functions if you want to use or GetErrorMessage.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Native.SetError(System.Int32)
member.summary: Calls API SetLastError, which sets the Windows API error code of this thread.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Native.GetError
member.summary: Gets the Windows API error code of this thread. Calls .
member.remarks:
Many Windows API functions, when failed, set an error code. Code 0 means no error. It is stored in an internal thread-specific int variable. But only if the API declaration's DllImport attribute has SetLastError = true. Some functions of this library simply call these API functions and don't throw exception when API fail. For example, most Wnd propery-get functions. When failed, they return false/0/null/empty. Then you can call Native.GetError to get the error code. Also you can use GetErrorMessage.
Most of these functions set the code only when failed, and don't clear old error code when succeeded. Therefore may need to call before.
Windows API error code definitions and documentation are not included in this library. You can look for them in API function documentation on the internet.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Native.GetErrorMessage
member.summary: Gets the text message of the Windows API error code of this thread. Returns null if the code is 0. The string always ends with ".".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Native.GetErrorMessage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the text message of a Windows API error code. Returns null if errorCode is 0. The string always ends with ".".

member.name: T:Catkeys.Files
member.summary: File system functions. Works with files and directories. Disk drives like @"C:\" or "C:" are directories too. Extends .NET file system classes such as File and Directory. Many functions of this class can be used instead of existing similar .NET functions that are slow, limited or unreliable. Most functions support only full path. Most of them throw ArgumentException if passed a filename or relative path, ie in "current directory". Using current directory is unsafe; it was relevant only in DOS era. Most functions support extended-length paths (longer than 259). Such local paths should have @"\\?\" prefix, like @"\\?\C:\...". Such network path should be like @"\\?\UNC\server\share\...". See , . Many functions support long paths even without prefix.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Files.Misc
member.summary: Miscellaneous functions.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Files.Misc.FileId
member.summary: Contains file properties that can be used to uniquely identify the file on a single computer. Can be used with files and directories. To get it, use .
member.remarks: Path to the same file or directory can be specified in many different ways. To determine whether two paths represent to the same file, get and compare FileId of them.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Files.Misc.FileId.FileIndex

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Misc.LibIsSameFile(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Calls for two paths and returns true if both calls succeed and the ids are equal. Paths should be normalized. They are passed to API unmodified. If DEBUG is defined, calls DebugPrint if some GetFileId call fails.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Files.Misc.DisableRedirection
member.summary: Temporarily disables file system redirection, to allow this 32-bit process access the 64-bit System32 directory.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Misc.DisableRedirection.Disable
member.summary: If Ver.Is32BitProcessOn64BitOS, calls API Wow64DisableWow64FsRedirection, which disables file system redirection. The caller can call this without checking OS and process bitness. This function checks it and it is fast. Always call or Dispose, for example in finally{}, or use using (this struct implements IDisposable). Not calling it is more dangerous than a memory leak. It is not called by GC.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Misc.DisableRedirection.Revert
member.summary: If redirected, calls API Wow64RevertWow64FsRedirection.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Misc.DisableRedirection.IsSystem64PathIn32BitProcess(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if Ver.Is32BitProcessOn64BitOS is true and path starts with Folders.System. Most such paths are redirected, therefore you may want to disable redirection with this class.
member.param: Normalized path. This function does not normalize. Also it is unaware of @"\\?\".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Misc.DisableRedirection.GetNonRedirectedSystemPath(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: If Ver.Is32BitProcessOn64BitOS is true and path starts with Folders.System, replaces that path part with . It disables redirection to Folders.SystemX32 for that path.
member.param: Normalized path. This function does not normalize. Also it is unaware of @"\\?\".
Don't replace path if the file or directory exists in the redirected folder or does not exist in the non-redirected folder.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Misc.DisableRedirection.Dispose
member.summary: Calls .

member.name: F:Catkeys.Files.GAFlags.DoNotThrow
member.summary: If failed, return false and don't throw exception. Then, if you need error info, you can use . If the file/directory does not exist, it will return ERROR_FILE_NOT_FOUND or ERROR_PATH_NOT_FOUND or ERROR_NOT_READY. If failed and the native error code is ERROR_ACCESS_DENIED or ERROR_SHARING_VIOLATION, the returned attributes will be (FileAttributes)(-1). The file probably exists but is protected so that this process cannot access and use it. Else attributes will be 0.

Returns AccessDenied (< 0) if exists but this process cannot access it and get attributes. Calls API GetFileAttributes. The same as but provides more complete result. In most cases you can use ExistsAs, it's simpler.
member.param: Full path. Supports @"\.." etc. If useRawPath is false (default), supports environment variables (see ).
Pass path to the API as it is, without any normalizing and full-path checking.
member.remarks: Supports . If you need exception when fails, instead call and check attributes Directory and ReparsePoint. Always use full path. If path is not full: if useRawPath is false (default) returns NotFound; if useRawPath is true, searches in "current directory".

Pass path to the API as it is, without any normalizing and full-path checking.
member.remarks: Supports . If you need exception when fails, instead call . Always use full path. If path is not full: if useRawPath is false (default) returns NotFound; if useRawPath is true, searches in "current directory". For symbolic links etc, returns true if the link exists. member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.SearchPath(System.String,System.String[])
member.summary: Finds file or directory and returns full path. Returns null if cannot be found. If the path argument is full path, calls and returns normalized path if exists, null if not. Else searches in these places: 1. dirs, if used. 2. . 3. Calls API SearchPath, which searches in process directory, Windows system directories, current directory, PATH environment variable. The search order depends on API SetSearchPathMode or registry settings. 4. If path ends with ".exe", tries to get path from registry "App Paths" keys.
member.param: Full or relative path or just filename with extension. Supports network paths too.
0 or more directories where to search.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Files.EDFlags
member.summary: flags for .

member.name: F:Catkeys.Files.EDFlags.AndSubdirectories
member.summary: Enumerate subdirectories too.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Files.EDFlags.AndSymbolicLinkSubdirectories
member.summary: Also enumerate symbolic link and mounted folder target directories. Use with AndSubdirectories.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Files.EDFlags.SkipHidden
member.summary: Skip files and subdirectories that have Hidden attribute.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Files.EDFlags.SkipHiddenSystem
member.summary: Skip files and subdirectories that have Hidden and System attributes (both). These files/directories usually are created and used only by the operating system. Drives usually have several such directories. Another example - thumbnail cache files. Without this flag the function skips only these hidden-system root directories when enumerating a drive: "$Recycle.Bin", "System Volume Information", "Recovery". If you want to include them too, use network path of the drive, for example @"\\localhost\D$\" for D drive.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Files.EDFlags.IgnoreAccessDeniedErrors
member.summary: If fails to get contents of the directory or a subdirectory because of its security settings, assume that the [sub]directory is empty. Without this flag then throws exception or calls errorHandler.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Files.EDFlags.DisableRedirection
member.summary: Temporarily disable file system redirection in this thread of this 32-bit process running on 64-bit Windows. Then you can enumerate the 64-bit System32 folder in your 32-bit process. Uses API Wow64DisableWow64FsRedirection. For vice versa (in 64-bit process enumerate the 32-bit System folder), instead use path Folders.SystemX86.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Files.EDFlags.UseRawPath
member.summary: Don't call (directoryPath) and don't throw exception for non-full path.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Files.EDFlags.NeedRelativePaths
member.summary: Let be path relative to the specified directory path. Like @"\name.txt" or @"\subdirectory\name.txt" instead of "name.txt".

member.name: T:Catkeys.Files.CopyFlags
member.summary: flags for and some other similar functions. Used only when copying directory.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Files.CopyFlags.SkipHiddenSystem
member.summary: Skip descendant files and directories that have Hidden and System attributes (both). They usually are created and used only by the operating system. Drives usually have several such directories. Another example - thumbnail cache files. They often are protected and would fail to copy, ruining whole copy operation. Without this flag the function skips only these hidden-system root directories when enumerating a drive: "$Recycle.Bin", "System Volume Information", "Recovery".

member.name: F:Catkeys.Files.CopyFlags.IgnoreAccessDeniedErrors
member.summary: If fails to get contents of the directory or a subdirectory because of its security settings, don't throw exception but assume that the [sub]directory is empty.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Files.EDFile

member.name: P:Catkeys.Files.EDFile.Size

member.name: P:Catkeys.Files.EDFile.IsDirectory

member.name: P:Catkeys.Files.EDFile.Level
member.summary: Descendant level. 0 if direct child of directoryPath, 1 if child of child, an so on.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.EDFile.SkipThisDirectory

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.EDFile.ToString

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.EnumDirectory(System.String,Catkeys.Files.EDFlags,System.Func{Catkeys.Files.EDFile,System.Boolean},System.Action{System.String})
member.summary: Gets names and other info of files and subdirectories in the specified directory. Returns an enumerable collection of objects containing the info. By default gets only direct children. Use flag to get all descendants.
member.param: Full path of the directory.

A callback function to call for each file and subdirectory. If it returns false, the file/subdirectory is not included in results. This can be useful when EnumDirectory is called indirectly, for example by the Copy method. If you call it directly, you can instead skip processing the file in your foreach loop.

A callback function to call when fails to get children of a subdirectory, when using flag EDFlags.AndSubdirectories. It receives the subdirectory path. It can call and throw an exception. If it does not throw an exception, the enumeration continues as if the directory is empty. If errorHandler not used, then throws exception. Read more in Remarks.
member.exception: directoryPath is invalid path or not full path.
directoryPath directory does not exist.
Failed to get children of directoryPath or of a subdirectory. Read more in Remarks.
member.remarks:
Uses API FindFirstFile.
The paths that this function gets are normalized, ie may not start with exact directoryPath string. Expanded environment variables (see ), "..", DOS path etc. Paths longer than have @"\\?\" prefix (see ). For symbolic links and mounted folders, gets info of the link/folder and not of its target.
These errors are ignored: 1. Access denied (usually because of security permissions), unless used flag FailIfAccessDenied. 2. Missing target directory of a symbolic link or mounted folder. When an error is ignored, the function works as if that [sub]directory is empty; does not throw exception and does not call errorHandler.
Enumeration of a subdirectory starts immediately after the subdirectory itself is retrieved.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Files.IfExists
member.summary: What to do if the destibnation directory contains a file or directory with the same name as the source file or directory when copying, moving or renaming. Used with , and similar functions. When renaming or moving, if the destination is the same as the source, these options are ignored and the destination is simply renamed. For example when renaming "file.txt" to "FILE.TXT".

member.name: F:Catkeys.Files.IfExists.Fail
member.summary: Throw exception. Default.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Files.IfExists.Delete
member.summary: Delete destination.

member.summary: Moves (changes path of) file or directory.

New full path. It is not the new parent directory. Use for it.

In most cases uses API MoveFileEx. It's fast, because don't need to copy files. In these cases copies/deletes: destination is on another drive; need to merge directories. When need to copy, does not copy the security properties; sets default security properties.
Creates the destination directory if does not exist (see ). If path and newPath share the same parent directory, just renames the file.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Files.Delete(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Deletes file or directory. Does nothing (no exception) if it does not exist or cannot be found.
member.param: Full path.
Send to Recycle Bin. Note: it is much slower.
member.exception: path is not full path (see ).
Failed.
member.remarks:
If directory, also deletes all its files and subdirectories. If fails to delete some, tries to delete as many as possible. Does not fail if is read-only or contains read-only files.
Some reasons why this function can fail: 1. The file is open (in any process). Or a file in the directory is open. 2. This process does not have security permissions to access or delete the file or directory or some of its descendants. 3. The directory is (or contains) the "current directory" (in any process).

member.remarks: If the directory already exists, this function does nothing, and returns false. Else, at first it creates missing parent/ancestor directories, then creates the specified (path) directory. To create the specified directory, calls API CreateDirectory or CreateDirectoryEx (if templateDirectory is not null).

member.name: T:Catkeys.Shell
member.summary: Windows shell functions. Windows shell manages files, folders (directories), shortcuts and virtual objects such as Control Panel.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl
member.summary: A Pidl variable holds and manages an ITEMIDLIST pointer. An ITEMIDLIST is a native variable-length structure that represents a file or other shell object and is used by Windows shell API instead of file-system path. With shell API is used ITEMIDLIST pointer (PIDL) as IntPtr. This class has an implicit Pidl-to-IntPtr cast operator and therefore a Pidl variable can be passed to shell API IntPtr parameters. The ITEMIDLIST is in unmanaged memory, therefore this class implements IDisposable.
member.remarks: When calling shell API, virtual objects can be identified only by ITEMIDLIST. Some API also support "parsing name", which usually looks like "::{CLSID-1}\::{CLSID-2}". File-system objects can be identified by path as well as by ITEMIDLIST. URLs can be identified by URL as well as by ITEMIDLIST.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.op_Implicit(Catkeys.Shell.Pidl)~System.IntPtr
member.summary: Gets the ITEMIDLIST pointer (PIDL).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.#ctor(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Assigns an ITEMIDLIST to this variable.
member.param: ITEMIDLIST pointer (PIDL). It can be created by any API that creates ITEMIDLIST. They allocate the memory with API CoTaskMemAlloc. This variable will finally free it with Marshal.FreeCoTaskMem.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.Dispose
member.summary: Frees the ITEMIDLIST with Marshal.FreeCoTaskMem and clears this variable.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.Detach
member.summary: Gets the ITEMIDLIST and clears this variable so that it cannot be used and will not free the ITEMIDLIST memory. To free it you can use Marshal.FreeCoTaskMem.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.FromString(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts string to ITEMIDLIST and creates new Pidl variable that holds it. Returns null if failed. Note: Pidl is disposable.
member.param: A file-system path or URL or shell object parsing name (see ) or ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST" (see ). Supports environment variables (see ).
If failed, throw CatException.
member.exception: Failed, and throwIfFailed is true. Probably invalid s.
member.remarks: Calls SHParseDisplayName, except when string is ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST". Never fails if s is ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST", even if it creates an invalid ITEMIDLIST.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.LibFromString(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The same as , just returns unmanaged ITEMIDLIST pointer (PIDL). Later need to free it with Marshal.FreeCoTaskMem.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.ToShellString(Catkeys.Native.SIGDN,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts the ITEMIDLIST to file path or URL or shell object parsing name or display name, depending on stringType argument. Returns null if this variable does not have an ITEMIDLIST (eg disposed or detached). If failed, returns null or throws exception.
member.param: String format. Often used: Native.SIGDN.SIGDN_NORMALDISPLAY - returns object name without path. It is best to display in UI but cannot be parsed to create ITEMIDLIST again. Native.SIGDN.SIGDN_FILESYSPATH - returns path if the ITEMIDLIST identifies a file system object (file or directory). Else returns null. Native.SIGDN.SIGDN_URL - if URL, returns URL. If file system object, returns its path like "file:///C:/a/b.txt". Else returns null. Native.SIGDN.SIGDN_DESKTOPABSOLUTEPARSING - returns path (if file system object) or URL (if URL) or shell object parsing name (if virtual object eg Control Panel). Note: not all returned parsing names can actually be parsed to create ITEMIDLIST again, therefore usually it's better to use instead.
If failed, throw CatException.
member.exception: Failed, and throwIfFailed is true.
member.remarks: Calls SHGetNameFromIDList.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.LibToShellString(System.IntPtr,Catkeys.Native.SIGDN,System.Boolean)
member.summary: The same as , just uses an ITEMIDLIST pointer that is not stored in a Pidl variable.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.ToString
member.summary: Converts the ITEMIDLIST to string. If it identifies an existing file-system object (file or directory), returns path. If URL, returns URL. Else returns ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST" (see ). Returns null if this variable does not have an ITEMIDLIST (eg disposed or detached).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.LibToString(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The same as , just uses an ITEMIDLIST pointer that is not stored in a Pidl variable.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.ToHexString
member.summary: Returns string ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST". It can be used with some functions of this library, mostly of classes Shell, Shell.Pidl and Icons. Cannot be used with native and .NET functions. Returns null if this variable does not have an ITEMIDLIST (eg disposed or detached).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Pidl.LibToHexString(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: The same as , just uses an ITEMIDLIST pointer that is not stored in a Pidl variable.

member.summary: flags for .

member.summary: Show error message box if fails, for example if file not found. Note: this does not disable exceptions. Still need exception handling. Or call .

member.summary: If started new process, wait until it exits. Uses .

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.Run(System.String,System.String,Catkeys.Shell.RunFlags,Catkeys.Shell.RunMoreParams)
member.summary: Runs/opens a program, document, folder, URL, new email, Control Panel item etc. By default returns process id. If used flag WaitForExit, returns process exit code. Returns 0 if did not start new process or did not get process handle, usually because opened the document in an existing process.
member.param: Program, document or other item to run. Can be: Full path of a file or folder. Examples: @"C:\folder\file.txt", Folders.System + "notepad.exe", @"%Folders.System%\notepad.exe". Filename of a file or folder, like "notepad.exe". The function calls . URL, like "http://a.b.c/d". Supported are all registered protocols, not only http. For example "file:///path". Email, like "mailto:a@b.c". Subject, body etc also can be specified, and Google knows how. Shell object's ITEMIDLIST like ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST". See , . Can be used to open virtual folders and items like Control Panel. Shell object's parsing name, like "::{CLSID}". See , . Can be used to open virtual folders and items like Control Panel. To run a Windows Store App, use "shell:AppsFolder\WinStoreAppId" format. Examples: "shell:AppsFolder\Microsoft.WindowsCalculator_8wekyb3d8bbwe!App", "shell:AppsFolder\windows.immersivecontrolpanel_cw5n1h2txyewy!microsoft.windows.immersivecontrolpanel". To discover the string use or Google. Supports environment variables, like @"%TMP%\file.txt". See .
Command line arguments to pass to the program. This function expands environment variables if starts with "%" or "\"%".
Allows to specify more parameters.
member.exception: Failed. For example, the file does not exist.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Shell.RunSafe(System.String,System.String,Catkeys.Shell.RunFlags,Catkeys.Shell.RunMoreParams)
member.summary: Calls and handles exceptions. If Run throws exception, prints its Message and returns 0. Handles only exception of type CatException. It is thrown when fails, usually when the file does not exist. All parameters are the same. This is useful when you don't care whether Run succeeded, for example in CatMenu menu item command handlers. Using try/catch there would not look good.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Shell.RunMoreParams
member.summary: Used to pass more parameters to .

member.name: F:Catkeys.Shell.RunMoreParams.CurrentDirectory
member.summary: Initial "current directory" for the new process. If this is not set (null), the function gets parent directory path of the specified file that is to run, if possible (if its full path is specified or found). It's because some incorrectly designed programs look for their files in "current directory", and fail to start if initial "current directory" is not set to the program's directory. If this is "" or invalid or the function cannot find full path, the new process will inherit "current directory" of this process.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Shell.RunMoreParams.Verb
member.summary: File's right-click menu command, also known as verb. For example "edit", "print", "properties". The default verb is bold in the menu. Not all menu items will work. Some may have different name than in the menu. Use verb "RunAs" for "Run as administrator".

member.name: F:Catkeys.Shell.RunMoreParams.OwnerWindow
member.summary: A window that may be used as owner window of error message box. Also, new window should be opened on the same screen. However many programs ignore it.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Shell.RunMoreParams.WindowState
member.summary: Preferred window state. Many programs ignore it.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Shell.RunMoreParams.NeedProcessHandle
member.summary: Get process handle, if possible. The property will contain it.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Shell.RunMoreParams.ProcessHandle
member.summary: This is an [Out] value. When the function returns, if was set to true, contains process handle in a variable. null if did not start new process (eg opened the document in an existing process) or did not get process handle for some other reason. Note: WaitHandle is disposable.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Path_
member.summary: Extends the .NET class Path.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.ExpandEnvVar(System.String)
member.summary: If path starts with "%" or "\"%", expands environment variables enclosed in %, else just returns path. Also supports known folder names, like "%Folders.Documents%". More info in Remarks.
member.param: Any string. Can be null.
member.remarks:
Supports known folder names as you can get with class properties. Example: @"%Folders.Documents%\file.txt". Example: @"%Folders.Virtual.ControlPanel%" //gets ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST". Usually known folders are used like string path = Folders.Documents + "file.txt". It's easier and faster. However it cannot be used when you want to store paths in text files, registry, etc. Then this feature is useful. To get known folder path, this function calls .
This function is called by many functions of classes Path_, Files, Shell, Icons, some others, therefore all they support environment variables and known folders in path string.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibGetEnvVar(System.String)
member.summary: Gets environment variable's value. Returns "" if variable not found. Does not support Folders.X.
member.param: Case-insensitive name.
member.remarks: Environment variable values cannot be "" or null. Setting empty value removes the variable.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibEnvVarExists(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if environment variable exists.
member.param: Case-insensitive name.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.IsFullPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if path matches one of these wildcard patterns: @"?:\*" - local path, like @"C:\a\b.txt". Here ? is A-Z, a-z. @"?:" - drive name, like @"C:". Here ? is A-Z, a-z. Note: it is considered full path in this library, but for .NET and Windows API it is not full path. @"\\*" - network path, like @"\\server\share\...". Or has prefix @"\\?\".
member.param: Any string. Can be null.
member.remarks: Supports '/' characters too. Supports only file-system paths. Returns false if path is URL (use instead) or starts with "::". If path starts with "%environmentVariable%", returns false, and in DEBUG configuration shows warning. You should at first expand environment variables with or instead use .

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.IsFullPathEEV(System.String@)
member.summary: Calls with expanded environment variables. Returns true if path matches one of these wildcard patterns: @"?:\*" - local path, like @"C:\a\b.txt". Here ? is A-Z, a-z. @"?:" - drive name, like @"C:". Here ? is A-Z, a-z. Note: it is considered full path in this library, but for .NET and Windows API it is not full path. @"\\*" - network path, like @"\\server\share\...". Or has prefix @"\\?\".
member.param: Any string. Can be null. If starts with '%' character, calls with expanded environment variables (). If it returns true, replaces the passed variable with the expanded path string.
member.remarks: Supports '/' characters too. Supports only file-system paths. Returns false if path is URL (use instead) or starts with "::".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.GetRootLength(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the length of the drive or network folder part in path, including its separator if any. If the string does not start with a drive or network folder path, returns 0 or prefix length (@"\\?\" or @"\\?\UNC\").
member.param: Full path or any string. Can be null. Should not be "%environmentVariable%\...".
member.remarks: Supports prefixes @"\\?\" and @"\\?\UNC\". Supports separators '\\' and '/'.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.GetUrlProtocolLength(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the length of the URL protocol name (also known as URI scheme) in string, including ':'. If the string does not start with a protocol name, returns 0. URL examples: "http:" (returns 5), "http://www.x.com" (returns 5), "file:///path" (returns 5), "shell:etc" (returns 6). The protocol can be unknown, the function just checks string format, which is an ASCII alpha character followed by one or more ASCII alpha-numeric, '.', '-', '+' characters, followed by ':' character.
member.param: A URL or path or any string. Can be null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.IsUrl(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if the string starts with a URL protocol name (existing or not) and ':' character. URL examples: "http:", "http://www.x.com", "file:///path", "shell:etc". Calls and returns true if it's not 0.
member.param: A URL or path or any string. Can be null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.Combine(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Combines two path parts, for example directory path and file name. Joins them using character '\\' so that there will not be two '\\' or '/'.
member.param: First path. Usually a directory.
Second path. Usually a filename or relative path. If s2CanBeFullPath is true, can be full path.
Call (ref s2). If it returns true, return s2 (ignore s1). Then also expands environment variables. If false, simply combines s1 and s2, creating invalid path if s2 is full path.
member.remarks: If s1 and s2 are null or "", returns "". Else if s1 is null or "", returns s2. Else if s2 is null or "", returns s1. Similar to Path.Combine (.NET function). Main differences: does not throw exceptions; does not ignore s1 if s2 is a relative path starting with @"\" or "/". See also .

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibCombine(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Combines two path parts. Unlike Path_.Combine, fails if some part is empty or @"\" or if s2 is @"\\". Also does not check s2 full path. If fails, throws exception or returns null (if noException).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibIsSepChar(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns true if character c == '\\' || c == '/'.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_._EndsWithDriveWithoutSep(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if ends with ':' preceded by a drive letter, like "C:" or "more\C:", but not like "moreC:".
member.param: Can be null.
Use when want to check drive at a middle, not at the end. Eg returns true if s is @"C:\more" and length is 2.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_._AddRemoveSep(System.String)
member.summary: Ensures that s either ends with a valid drive path (eg @"C:\" but not "C:") or does not end with '\\' or '/' (unless would become empty if removed).
member.param: Can be null.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Path_.NormalizeFlags
member.summary: flags for .

member.name: F:Catkeys.Path_.NormalizeFlags.DoNotExpandDosPath
member.summary: Don't call API GetLongPathName.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Path_.NormalizeFlags.DoNotPrefixLongPath
member.summary: Don't call .

member.name: F:Catkeys.Path_.NormalizeFlags.DoNotRemoveEndSeparator
member.summary: Don't remove '\\' character at the end.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Path_.NormalizeFlags.CanBeUrlOrShell
member.summary: If path is not a file-system path but looks like URL (eg "http:..." or "file:...") or starts with "::", don't throw exception and don't process more (only expand environment variables).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.Normalize(System.String,System.String,Catkeys.Path_.NormalizeFlags)
member.summary: Makes normal full path from path that can contain special substrings etc. The sequence of actions: 1. If path starts with '%' character, expands environment variables (see ). 2. If path is not full path but looks like URL, and used flag CanBeUrl, returns path. 3. If path is not full path, and defaultParentDirectory is not null/"", combines path with defaultParentDirectory. 4. If path is not full path, throws exception. 5. Calls API GetFullPathName. It replaces '/' to '\\', replaces multiple '\\' to single (where need), processes @"\.." etc, trims spaces, etc. 6. If no flag DoNotExpandDosPath, if contains '~' character, calls API GetLongPathName. It converts short DOS path to normal path, if possible, for example @"c:\progra~1" to @"c:\program files". It is slow. It converts path only if the file exists. 7. If no flag DoNotRemoveEndSeparator, removes '\\' character at the end, unless it is a drive path (eg @"C:\"). 8. Appends '\\' character if ends with a drive name (eg "C:" -> @"C:\"). 9. If no flag DoNotPrefixLongPath, calls , which adds @"\\?\" etc prefix if path is very long.
member.param: Any path.
If path is not full path, combine it with defaultParentDirectory to make full path.
member.exception: path is not full path, and defaultParentDirectory is not used or does not make it full path.
member.remarks: Similar to . Main differences: this function expands environment variables, does not support relative paths, supports @"\\?\very long path", trims '\\' at the end if need, does not throw exceptions when [it thinks that] path is invalid (except when path is not full).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibNormalize(System.String,Catkeys.Path_.NormalizeFlags,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Same as , but skips full-path checking. s should be full path. If not full and not null/"", combines with current directory.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibExpandDosPath(System.String)
member.summary: Calls API GetLongPathName. Currently does not check whether s contains '~' character. Note: the API is slow.
member.param: Can be null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibNormalizeMinimally(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Prepares path for passing to API that support "..", DOS path etc. Calls ExpandEnvVar, _AddRemoveSep, PrefixLongPathIfNeed. Optionally throws if !IsFullPath(path).
member.exception: Not full path (only if throwIfNotFullPath is true).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibIsShellPath(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if starts with "::".
member.param: Can be null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.PrefixLongPath(System.String)
member.summary: If path is full path and does not start with @"\\?\", prepends @"\\?\". If path is network path (like @"\\computer\folder\..."), makes like @"\\?\UNC\computer\folder\...".
member.param: Path. Can be null. Must not start with "%environmentVariable%", this function does not expand it. See .
member.remarks: Windows API kernel functions support extended-length paths, ie longer than 259 characters. But the path must have this prefix. Windows API shell functions don't support it.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.PrefixLongPathIfNeed(System.String)
member.summary: Calls if path is longer than (247).
member.param: Path. Can be null. Must not start with "%environmentVariable%", this function does not expand it. See .

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.UnprefixLongPath(System.String)
member.summary: If path starts with @"\\?\" prefix, removes it. If path starts with @"\\?\UNC\" prefix, removes @"?\UNC\".
member.param: Path. Can be null. Must not start with "%environmentVariable%", this function does not expand it. See .

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_._GetPrefixLength(System.String)
member.summary: If s starts with @"\\?\UNC\", returns 8. Else if starts with @"\\?\", returns 4. Else returns 0.
member.param: Can be null.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Path_.MaxFilePathLength
member.summary: Maximal file (not directory) path length supported by all functions (native, .NET and this library). For longer paths need @"\\?\" prefix. It is supported by most native kernel API (but not shell API) and by most functions of this library.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Path_.MaxDirectoryPathLength
member.summary: Maximal directory path length supported by all functions (native, .NET and this library). For longer paths need @"\\?\" prefix. It is supported by most native kernel API (but not shell API) and by most functions of this library.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.CorrectFileName(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Replaces characters that cannot be used in file names. Also corrects other forms of invalid or problematic filename: trims spaces and other blank characters; replaces "." at the end; prepends "@" if a reserved name like "CON" or "CON.txt"; returns "-" if name is null/empty/whitespace. Returns valid filename. However it can be too long (itself or when combined with a directory path).
member.param: Initial filename.
A string that will replace each invalid character. Default "-".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.IsInvalidFileName(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if name cannot be used for a file name, eg contains '\\' etc characters or is empty. More info: .
member.param: Any string. Can be null. Example: "name.txt".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.GetFileName(System.String)
member.summary: Gets filename with extension. Returns "" if there is no filename. Returns null if path is null.
member.param: Path or filename.
member.remarks:
Similar to . Some diferences: does not throw exceptions; if ends with '\\' or '/', gets part before it, eg "B" from @"C:\A\B\". Supports separators '\\' and '/'. Also supports URL and shell parsing names like @"::{CLSID-1}\0\::{CLSID-2}". Example paths and results:
@"C:\A\B\file.txt" -> "file.txt". "file.txt" -> "file.txt". "file" -> "file". @"C:\A\B" -> "B". @"C:\A\B\" -> "B". @"C:\A\/B\/" -> "B". @"C:\" -> "". @"C:" -> "". @"\\network\share" -> "share". @"C:\aa\file.txt:alt.stream" -> "file.txt:alt.stream". "http://a.b.c" -> "a.b.c". "::{A}\::{B}" -> "::{B}". "" -> "". null -> null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.GetFileNameWithoutExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Gets filename without extension. Returns "" if there is no filename. Returns null if path is null.
member.param: Path or filename.
member.remarks:
Similar to Some diferences: does not throw exceptions; if ends with '\\' or '/', gets part before it, eg "B" from @"C:\A\B\" (then does not remove extension from it because it is a directory name). Supports separators '\\' and '/'. Also supports URL and shell parsing names like @"::{CLSID-1}\0\::{CLSID-2}". Example paths and results:
@"C:\A\B\file.txt" -> "file". "file.txt" -> "file". "file" -> "file". @"C:\A\B" -> "B". @"C:\A\B\" -> "B". @"C:\A\B.B\" -> "B.B". @"C:\" -> "". @"C:" -> "". @"\\network\share" -> "share". @"C:\aa\file.txt:alt.stream" -> "file.txt:alt". "http://a.b.c" -> "a.b". "::{A}\::{B}" -> "::{B}". "" -> "". null -> null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.GetExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Gets filename extension, like ".txt". Returns "" if there is no extension. Returns null if path is null.
member.param: Path or filename.
member.remarks: Supports separators '\\' and '/'. Like , but does not throw exceptions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.GetDirectoryPath(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes filename part from path. By default also removes separator ('\\' or '/') if it is not after drive name (eg "C:"). Returns "" if the string is a filename. Returns null if the string is a root (like @"C:\" or "C:" or @"\\server\share" or "http:"). Returns null if the string is null.
member.param: Path or filename.
Don't remove the separator character(s) ('\\' or '/'). Examples: from @"C:\A\B" gets @"C:\A\", not @"C:\A"; from "http://x.y" gets "http://", not "http:".
member.remarks:
Similar to . Some diferences: does not throw exceptions; skips '\\' or '/' at the end (eg from @"C:\A\B\" gets @"C:\A", not @"C:\A\B"); does not expand DOS path; much faster. Parses raw string. You may want to it at first. Supports separators '\\' and '/'. Also supports URL and shell parsing names like @"::{CLSID-1}\0\::{CLSID-2}". Example paths and results (withSeparator=false):
@"C:\A\B\file.txt" -> @"C:\A\B". "file.txt" -> "". @"C:\A\B\" -> @"C:\A". @"C:\A\/B\/" -> @"C:\A". @"C:\" -> null. @"\\network\share" -> null. "http:" -> null. @"C:\aa\file.txt:alt.stream" -> "C:\aa". "http://a.b.c" -> "http:". "::{A}\::{B}" -> "::{A}". "" -> "". null -> null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibIsExtension(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if s is like ".ext" and the ext part does not contain characters ".\\/:".
member.param: Can be null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Path_.LibIsProtocol(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true if s is like "protocol:" and not like "c:" or "protocol:more".
member.param: Can be null.

member.summary: Classic Windows version major+minor values that can be used with . Example: if(Ver.WinVer >= Ver.Win8) ...

member.name: F:Catkeys.Ver.Win8
member.summary: Classic Windows version major+minor values that can be used with . Example: if(Ver.WinVer >= Ver.Win8) ...

member.summary: Classic Windows version major+minor values that can be used with . Example: if(Ver.WinVer >= Ver.Win8) ...

member.name: F:Catkeys.Ver.Win10
member.summary: Classic Windows version major+minor values that can be used with . Example: if(Ver.WinVer >= Ver.Win8) ...

member.name: P:Catkeys.Ver.MinWin8
member.summary: true if Windows 8.0 or later.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Ver.MinWin8_1
member.summary: true if Windows 8.1 or later.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Ver.MinWin10

member.name: P:Catkeys.Ver.Is64BitProcess
member.summary: true if this process is 64-bit, false if 32-bit. The same as .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Ver.Is64BitOS
member.summary: true if Windows is 64-bit, false if 32-bit. The same as , but fast. The .NET function is slow in 32-bit process; they forgot to optimize it.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Ver.Is32BitProcessOn64BitOS
member.summary: Returns true if this process is a 32-bit process running on 64-bit Windows. Also known as WOW64 process.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Calc
member.summary: Simple calculation functions, similar to Math.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.MakeUint(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates uint by placing (ushort)loWord in bits 1-16 and (ushort)hiWord in bits 17-32. Like C macro MAKELONG, MAKEWPARAM, MAKELPARAM, MAKELRESULT.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.MakeUint(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates uint by placing (ushort)loWord in bits 1-16 and (ushort)hiWord in bits 17-32. Like C macro MAKELONG, MAKEWPARAM, MAKELPARAM, MAKELRESULT.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.MakeUshort(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: Creates ushort by placing (byte)loByte in bits 1-8 and (byte)hiByte in bits 9-16. Like C macro MAKEWORD.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.MakeUshort(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates ushort by placing (byte)loByte in bits 1-8 and (byte)hiByte in bits 9-16. Like C macro MAKEWORD.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.LoUshort(Catkeys.LPARAM)
member.summary: Gets bits 1-16 as ushort. Like C macro LOWORD.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.HiUshort(Catkeys.LPARAM)
member.summary: Gets bits 17-32 as ushort. Like C macro HIWORD.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.LoShort(Catkeys.LPARAM)
member.summary: Gets bits 1-16 as short. Like C macro GET_X_LPARAM.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.HiShort(Catkeys.LPARAM)
member.summary: Gets bits 17-32 as short. Like C macro GET_Y_LPARAM.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.LoByte(Catkeys.LPARAM)
member.summary: Gets bits 1-8 as byte. Like C macro LOBYTE.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.HiByte(Catkeys.LPARAM)
member.summary: Gets bits 9-16 as byte. Like C macro HIBYTE.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.MulDiv(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Multiplies number and numerator without overflow, and divides by denominator. The return value is rounded up or down to the nearest integer. If either an overflow occurred or denominator was 0, the return value is 1.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.Percent(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns percent of part in whole.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.Percent(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Returns percent of part in whole.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.AlignUp(System.UInt32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: If value is divisible by alignment, returns value. Else returns nearest bigger number that is divisible by alignment.
member.param: An integer value.
Alignment. Must be a power of two (2, 4, 8, 16...).
member.remarks: For example if alignment is 4, returns 4 if value is 1-4, returns 8 if value is 5-8, returns 12 if value is 9-10, and so on.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.AlignUp(System.Int32,System.UInt32)
member.summary: If value is divisible by alignment, returns value. Else returns nearest bigger number that is divisible by alignment.
member.param: An integer value.
Alignment. Must be a power of two (2, 4, 8, 16...).
member.remarks: For example if alignment is 4, returns 4 if value is 1-4, returns 8 if value is 5-8, returns 12 if value is 9-10, and so on.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.MinMax(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns value but not less than min and not greater than max. If value is less than min, returns min. If value is greater than max, returns max.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.IsDigit(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns true if character is '0' to '9'.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.IsAlpha(System.Char)
member.summary: Returns true if character is 'A' to 'Z' or 'a' to 'z'.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.AngleFromXY(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates angle degrees from coordinates x and y.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.HashFnv1(System.String)
member.summary: FNV-1 hash. Useful for fast hash table and checksum use, not cryptography. Similar to CRC32; faster but creates more collisions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.HashFnv1(System.Char*,System.Int32)
member.summary: FNV-1 hash. Useful for fast hash table and checksum use, not cryptography. Similar to CRC32; faster but creates more collisions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.HashFnv1(System.Byte[])
member.summary: FNV-1 hash. Useful for fast hash table and checksum use, not cryptography. Similar to CRC32; faster but creates more collisions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.HashFnv1(System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary: FNV-1 hash. Useful for fast hash table and checksum use, not cryptography. Similar to CRC32; faster but creates more collisions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.HashMD5(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Computes MD5 hash of binary data. The same as Hash(..., "MD5") but much faster.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.HashMD5(System.String)
member.summary: Computes MD5 hash of string. The same as Hash(..., "MD5") but much faster.

member.summary: Computes MD5 hash of binary data and converts to hex string. The same as Hash(..., "MD5") but much faster.

member.summary: Computes MD5 hash of string and converts to hex string. The same as Hash(..., "MD5") but much faster.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.Hash(System.Byte[],System.String)
member.summary: Computes binary data hash using a specified cryptographic algorithm.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.Hash(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Computes string hash using a specified cryptographic algorithm.
member.param: Algorithm name, eg "SHA256".
member.remarks: The hash is of UTF8 bytes, not of UTF16 bytes.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.HashHex(System.Byte[],System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Computes binary data hash using a specified cryptographic algorithm and converts to hex string.
member.param: Algorithm name, eg "SHA256".
Let the hex string contain A-F, not a-f.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.HashHex(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Computes string hash using a specified cryptographic algorithm and converts to hex string.
member.param: Algorithm name, eg "SHA256".
Let the hex string contain A-F, not a-f.
member.remarks: The hash is of UTF8 bytes, not of UTF16 bytes.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.BytesToHexString(System.Byte[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts byte array (binary data) to hex-encoded string.
member.param: The data. Can be null.
Let the hex string contain A-F, not a-f.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.BytesToHexString(System.Void*,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts binary data to hex-encoded string.
member.param: The data. Can be any valid memory of specified size, for example a struct address. Can be null.
data memory size.
Let the hex string contain A-F, not a-f.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.BytesFromHexString(System.String)
member.summary: Converts hex-encoded string to byte array (binary data).
member.param: Hex-encoded string. Can be null.
member.remarks: Skips spaces and other non-hex-digit characters. Example: "01 23 46 67" is the same as "01234667". Skips hex-digits that are not in pair, for example 2 in "01 2 34".

member.name: M:Catkeys.Calc.BytesFromHexString(System.String,System.Void*,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Converts hex-encoded string to binary data. Returns the number of bytes stored in data memory. It is equal or less than Math.Min(size, (s.Length - startFrom) / 2).
member.param: Hex-encoded string. Can be null.
Where to write the data. Can be any valid memory of specified size, for example a struct address.
data memory size.
0 or index of first character of hex-encoded substring in s.
member.remarks: Skips spaces and other non-hex-digit characters. Example: "01 23 46 67" is the same as "01234667". Skips hex-digits that are not in pair, for example 2 in "01 2 34". This function is unsafe, it will damage process memory if using bad data or size.

member.name: T:Catkeys.InterDomain
member.summary: Inter-domain variables. Allows to share values by all app domains of this process. Similar to environment variables, but supports more types and does not inherit parent process variables; the speed is similar. Supports not all types. The type must have one of these properties: 1. Derived from MarshalByRefObject. The stored value is a virtual reference (proxy), not a copy. The owner domain must be still alive when other domains access (call methods etc) the retrieved value, else AppDomainUnloadedException. 2. Has [Serializable] attribute. The stored value is a copy, not reference. For example int, IntPtr, string, arrays, List, Dictionary.

member.name: M:Catkeys.InterDomain.SetVariable(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds or modifies an inter-domain variable.
member.param: Name. Can be any unique string, for example a GUID string. Case-sensitive.
Value.
member.exception: The type is not supported because is neither serializable nor MarshalByRefObject-derived.

member.name: M:Catkeys.InterDomain.GetVariable(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the value of an inter-domain variable. Returns null if the variable does not exist. Else returns the value as object; need a cast.
member.param: Name. Case-sensitive.

member.name: M:Catkeys.InterDomain.GetVariable``1(System.String,``0@)
member.summary: Gets the value of an inter-domain variable. Returns true if the variable exists and is not null.
member.param: Name. Case-sensitive.
Receives the value. If the variable does not exist, receives the default value of that type.
member.exception: Bad value type.

member.name: M:Catkeys.InterDomain.GetVariable``1(System.String,System.Func{``0})
member.summary: Gets the value of an inter-domain variable. If the variable does not exist or is null, calls a callback function that provides an initial value; then sets the variable = the initial value. Thread-safe.
member.param: Name. Case-sensitive.
A callback function delegate (eg lambda) that is called when the variable does not exist or is null. It must return an initial value.
member.exception: The type is not supported because is neither serializable nor MarshalByRefObject-derived.
Bad value type.

example.code: int test = InterDomain.GetVariable("test", () => 10);

member.name: M:Catkeys.InterDomain.DefaultDomainVariable``1(System.String,``0@)
member.summary: Gets a reference to an object that lives in default app domain. Auto-creates new object there if does not exist. The object can be used in any app domain. When a non-default domain calls its methods, the call is marshaled to the default domain and executed there. The type must be derived from MarshalByRefObject and have default constructor. Returns true if created new object, false if it already existed. Thread-safe.
member.param: Inter-domain variable name. Any unique string. Case-sensitive.
Receives the reference.

member.name: F:Catkeys.SetAddRemove.Set
member.summary: Set flags = the specified value.

member.name: F:Catkeys.SetAddRemove.Add

member.name: F:Catkeys.SetAddRemove.Remove

member.name: T:Catkeys.CatException
member.summary: The base exception used in this library. Some constructors support Windows API error code. Then Message will contain its error description. If the string passed to the constructor starts with "*", replaces the "*" with "Failed to ". If does not end with ".", appends ".".

member.name: M:Catkeys.CatException.#ctor
member.summary: Sets Message = "Failed.". Sets NativeErrorCode = 0.

member.name: M:Catkeys.CatException.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Sets Message = message. Sets NativeErrorCode = 0.

member.name: M:Catkeys.CatException.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets Message = "Failed. " + Native.GetErrorMessage(winApiErrorCode). Sets NativeErrorCode = (winApiErrorCode != 0) ? winApiErrorCode : Native.GetError().

member.name: M:Catkeys.CatException.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: Sets Message = message + " " + Native.GetErrorMessage(winApiErrorCode). Sets NativeErrorCode = (winApiErrorCode != 0) ? winApiErrorCode : Native.GetError().

member.name: M:Catkeys.CatException.#ctor(System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Sets Message = message + "\r\n\t" + innerException.Message. Sets NativeErrorCode = 0.

member.name: M:Catkeys.CatException.#ctor(System.Int32,System.String,System.Exception)
member.summary: Sets Message = message + " " + Native.GetErrorMessage(winApiErrorCode) + "\r\n\t" + innerException.Message. Sets NativeErrorCode = (winApiErrorCode != 0) ? winApiErrorCode : Native.GetError().

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatException.NativeErrorCode
member.summary: Gets the Windows API error code.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatException.Message
member.summary: Gets error message.

member.name: F:Catkeys.CatException.FormattedMessage
member.summary: String created by FormatMessage(), which should be called by the Message override if null. Initially null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.CatException.FormatMessage(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Formats error message. Sets and returns FormattedMessage. As base text, uses the text passed to the constructor (default "Failed."). If it starts with "*", replaces the "*" with "Failed to ". If it ends with "*", replaces the "*" with commonPostfix if it is not empty. If then the message does not end with ".", appends ".". If appendMessage is null, uses Native.GetErrorMessage(NativeErrorCode) if NativeErrorCode not 0. If then appendMessage is not empty, appends " " and appendMessage. Also appends InnerException.Message in new tab-indented line if InnerException is not null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.CatException.ThrowIfFailed(System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: If errorCode is not 0, throws CatException that includes the code and its message. More info: .
member.param: Windows API error code or HRESULT.
Main message. The message of the error code will be appended to it.

member.name: T:Catkeys.WndException
member.summary: Exception thrown mostly by functions.
member.remarks: Some constructors support Windows API error code. Then Message also will contain its error description. If error code ERROR_INVALID_WINDOW_HANDLE, Message also depends on whether the window handle is 0. If parameter 'winApiErrorCode' is 0 or not used: if the window handle is invalid, uses ERROR_INVALID_WINDOW_HANDLE. If the string passed to the constructor starts with "*", replaces the "*" with "Failed to ". If ends with "*", replaces the "*" with " window.". If does not end with ".", appends ".".

member.name: T:Catkeys.Types`2
member.summary: Used for method parameters that accept one of two types.
member.remarks:
Some methods have one or several parameters that must be one of several types. There are several ways of implementing such functions. 1. Overloaded methods. However some programmers often don't like it, because in some cases need to create many overloads, then maintain their documentation. Also then method users have to spend much time to find the correct overload. 2. Generic methods. However in most cases the compiler cannot protect from using an unsupported type. Also then method users don't see the allowed types instantly in intellisense. 3. Using the Object type for the parameter. However then the compiler does not protect from using an unsupported type. Also then method users don't see the allowed types instantly in intellisense. Also slower, especially with value types (need boxing). 4. Using this type for the parameter. It does not have the above problems.
When a parameter is of type Types<T1, T2>, method users can pass only values of type T1 or T2, else compiler error. They see the allowed types instantly in intellisense. Also there are similar types that can be used to support more parameter types:
To support null (for example for optional parameters), use nullable. See examples.

member.name: T:Catkeys.LPARAM
member.summary: Similar to IntPtr (can be 32-bit or 64-bit), but more useful for usually-non-pointer values, eg wParam/lParam of SendMessage. Unlike IntPtr: Has implicit casts from/to most integral types. Does not check overflow when casting from uint etc. IntPtr throws exception on overflow, which can create strange bugs.
member.remarks: There is no struct WPARAM. Use LPARAM instead, because it is the same in all cases except when casting to long or ulong (ambigous signed/unsigned). There is no cast operators for enum. When need, cast through int or uint. For Wnd cast through IntPtr.

member.name: M:Catkeys.RECT.MoveInScreen(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adjusts this rectangle so that it can be used to create a new window that will be entirely in specified screen. Initial coordinates must be relative to the specified screen. The function replaces them with coordinates relative to the primary screen. By default, 0 and negative left/top coordinates are interpreted as: 0 - screen center, <0 - relative to the right or bottom edge of the screen.
member.param: Use this screen. If null, use the primary screen. See .
Use the work area, not whole screen.
If rectangle is bigger than screen, resize it.
Don't interpret 0 and negative left/top coordinates in a special way. They are relative to the top-left corner of the screen.

member.name: M:Catkeys.RECT.EnsureInScreen(System.Object,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Adjusts a rectangle so that it can be used to create a new window that will be entirely in screen. Similar to MoveInScreen, but initial rectangle coordinates are relative to the primary screen and are not interpreted in a special way. The function adjusts rectangle coordinates to ensure that whole rectangle is in screen.
member.param: Use this screen. If null, use screen of the rectangle. See .
Use the work area, not whole screen.
If rectangle is bigger than screen, resize it.

member.name: F:Catkeys.RECT.Empty

member.name: T:Catkeys.Folders
member.summary: Gets known/special folder paths (Desktop, Temp, etc).
member.remarks:
For return values is used type , not string. It is implicitly convertible to string. Its operator + appends a filename or relative path string, with @"\" separator if need. Example: string s = Folders.Desktop + "file.txt"; //C:\Users\Name\Desktop\file.txt If a function cannot get folder path, the return value contains null string. Then the + operator would throw CatException.
Some folders are known only on newer Windows versions or only on some computers. Some property-get functions have a suffix like "_Win8" which means that the folder is unavailable on older Windows. Some known folders, although supported and registerd, may be still not created.
Some folders are virtual, for example Control Panel. They don't have a file system path, but can be identified by an unmanaged array called "ITEMIDLIST" or "PIDL". Functions of the nested class return it as . Functions of the nested class return it as string ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST" that can be used with some functions of this library (of classes Shell, Shell.Pidl, Icons) but not with .NET or native functions.
Most functions use Windows "Known Folders" API, such as SHGetKnownFolderPath. The list of Windows predefined known folders: KNOWNFOLDERID. Names of folders specific to this application have "This" prefix, like ThisApp.
Some paths depend on the bitness (32 or 64 bit) of the OS and this process. The example paths below are for English versions of Windows on most computers.
32-bit Windows
System, SystemX86, SystemX64: @"C:\WINDOWS\system32" ProgramFiles, ProgramFilesX86, ProgramFilesX64: @"C:\Program Files" ProgramFilesCommon, ProgramFilesCommonX86, ProgramFilesCommonX64: @"C:\Program Files\Common Files"
64-bit Windows, 64-bit process
System, SystemX64: @"C:\WINDOWS\system32" SystemX86: @"C:\WINDOWS\SysWOW64" ProgramFiles, ProgramFilesX64: @"C:\Program Files" ProgramFilesX86: @"C:\Program Files (x86)" ProgramFilesCommon, ProgramFilesCommonX64: @"C:\Program Files\Common Files" ProgramFilesCommonX86: @"C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files"
64-bit Windows, 32-bit process
System: @"C:\WINDOWS\system32". However the OS in most cases redirects this path to @"C:\WINDOWS\SysWOW64". SystemX86: @"C:\WINDOWS\SysWOW64" SystemX64: @"C:\WINDOWS\Sysnative". The OS redirects it to the true @"C:\WINDOWS\system32". It is a special path that you don't see in Explorer. ProgramFiles, ProgramFilesX86: @"C:\Program Files (x86)" ProgramFilesX64: @"C:\Program Files" ProgramFilesCommon, ProgramFilesCommonX86: @"C:\Program Files (x86)\Common Files" ProgramFilesCommonX64: @"C:\Program Files\Common Files"

member.summary: Temp folder (temporary files) of this user account.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisApp
member.summary: Folder containing assemblies of current app domain. Calls .
member.remarks: Unlike , this path can be different for each app domain; it is set when creating the AppDomain. See also , it gets full path (with file name) of current app domain's main/entry assembly.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisAppTemp
member.summary: Gets or sets path of the temporary files folder of this application. Default is Folders.Temp + Application.ProductName. The 'set' function does not change system settings, it just remembers a string that will be later returned by the 'get' function in this appdomain. The 'get' function creates the folder if does not exist.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisAppDocuments
member.summary: Gets or sets path of user document files folder of this application. Default is Folders.Documents + Application.ProductName. The 'set' function does not change system settings, it just remembers a string that will be later returned by the 'get' function in this appdomain. The 'get' function creates the folder if does not exist.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisAppData
member.summary: Gets or sets path of private files folder of this application on this user account. Default is Folders.RoamingAppData + Application.ProductName. The 'set' function does not change system settings, it just remembers a string that will be later returned by the 'get' function in this appdomain. The 'get' function creates the folder if does not exist.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisAppDataLocal
member.summary: Gets or sets path of local (non-roaming) private files folder of this application on this user account. Default is Folders.LocalAppData + Application.ProductName. The 'set' function does not change system settings, it just remembers a string that will be later returned by the 'get' function in this appdomain. The 'get' function creates the folder if does not exist.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisAppDataCommon
member.summary: Gets or sets path of common (all users) private files folder of this application. Default is Folders.ProgramData + Application.ProductName. The 'set' function does not change system settings, it just remembers a string that will be later returned by the 'get' function in this appdomain. Note: the ProgramData folder has special permissions. Programs running not as administrator usually cannot write there. This function does not auto-create the folder; usually it is created when installing the application.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisProcess
member.summary: Folder containing the program file of this process. Calls . Unlike , this path is the same for all app domains of this process.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.ThisAppImages
member.summary: Gets or sets path of images (icons etc) folder of this application. Default is ThisApp + "Images". Functions of these classes will look for image there: Icons, CatMenu, CatBar, possibly some other.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Folders.SystemX64
member.summary: Gets non-redirected path of the System32 folder.
member.remarks: If this process is 32-bit and OS is 64-bit, when it uses the folder path (@"C:\WINDOWS\system32"), the OS in most cases redirects it to @"C:\Windows\SysWOW64", which contains 32-bit versions of program files. Use SystemX64 when you want to avoid the redirection and access the true System32 folder which on 64-bit OS contains 64-bit program files. More info in class help.

member.remarks: Initially it is the main menu. In code of using(m.Submenu(...)) { code; }, m.Submenu(...); code; m.EndSubmenu(); and m.Submenu(..., m1 => { code; }); it is that submenu.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.LastMenuItem
member.summary: Gets the last added item as ToolStripMenuItem. Returns null if it is not a ToolStripMenuItem, eg a button or separator. The item can be added with m.Add(...), m[...]= and m.Submenu(...).
member.remarks: You can instead use LastItem, which gets ToolStripItem, which is the base class of all supported item types; cast it to a derived type if need.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.MultiShow
member.summary: If false, calls Dispose() when the menu is closed. If true, does not call Dispose(); then you can call Show() multiple times for the same object. Default is false, but is automatically set to true when showing the menu not with CatMenu.Show(), eg when assigned to a control.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.DefaultMultiShow
member.summary: Default MultiShow value for all new CatMenu instances.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.ModalAlways
member.summary: If true, Show() always waits until the menu is closed. If false, does not wait if the thread has a message loop (Application.MessageLoop==true).

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.ActivateMenuWindow
member.summary: Activate the menu window. It enables selecting menu items with the keyboard (arrows, Tab, Enter, etc). If false, only Esc works, it closes the menu. If the menu is owned by a control or toolbar button, keyboard navigation works in any case, don't need this property to enable it.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.DefaultActivateMenuWindow
member.summary: Default ActivateMenuWindow value for CatMenu instances. A CatMenu instance inherits this at the moment it is created.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.MouseClosingDistance
member.summary: Close the menu when the mouse cursor moves away from it to this distance, pixels. At first the mouse must be or move at less than half of the distance. Default is equal to CatMenu.DefaultMouseClosingDistance, default 200.

member.name: P:Catkeys.CatMenu.DefaultMouseClosingDistance
member.summary: Default MouseClosingDistance value of CatMenu instances. A CatMenu instance inherits this at the moment it is created.

member.name: M:Catkeys.CatMenu.Close
member.summary: Closes the menu and its submenus. Also closes its context menu (CMS.ContextMenu).

member.name: T:Catkeys.CatToolStrip
member.summary: Adds to ToolStrip: 1. User can click a button when the parent form is not the active window. 2. A click does not activate the parent form if it has WS_EX_NOACTIVATE style. 3. Can show tooltips when parent form is not the active window. To enable it, the form's ShowWithoutActivation override must return true (it is called when need to show a tooltip).

member.name: T:Catkeys.CatMenuStrip
member.summary: Adds to MenuStrip: 1. User can click an item when the parent form is not the active window. 2. A click does not activate the parent form if it has WS_EX_NOACTIVATE style. 3. Fixes some MenuStrip bugs.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Screen_
member.summary: Extends the .NET class Screen.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Screen_.Primary
member.summary: Special screen index to specify the primary screen.

member.summary: Special screen index to specify the screen of the active window.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Screen_.FromIndex(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets object from 1-based screen index. index also can be one of constants defined in this class: Primary (0), OfMouse, OfActiveWindow. If index is invalid, gets the primary screen.
member.remarks: As screen index is used index in the array returned by + 1. It is not the screen index that you can see in Control Panel.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Screen_.FromWindow(Catkeys.Wnd)
member.summary: Gets object of the screen that contains the specified window (the biggest part of it) or is nearest to it. If w handle is 0 or invalid, gets the primary screen ( would return an invalid object if the window handle is invalid).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Screen_.FromObject(System.Object)
member.summary: Gets object by index or of the screen that contains (or is nearest to) the specified window, rectangle or point.
member.param:
Depends on type:
null: primary screen (calls ).
int: 1-based screen index (calls ), or Screen_.Primary, Screen_.OfMouse, Screen_.OfActiveWindow.
Wnd: a window (calls ). If invalid, gets primary screen.
POINT, Point: a point (calls ).
RECT, Rectangle: a rectangle (calls ).
Screen: a object. If invalid, gets primary screen.
member.remarks: If something fails, gets primary screen. As screen index is used index in the array returned by + 1. It is not the screen index that you can see in Control Panel.

member.summary: Converts color from ARGB (0xAARRGGBB) to ABGR (0xAABBGGRR) or vice versa (swaps the red and blue bytes). ARGB is used in .NET, GDI+ and HTML/CSS. ABGR is used by most Windows native API.

member.summary: Converts from System.Drawing.Color to native Windows COLORREF with alpha (0xAABBGGRR).

member.summary: Converts from native Windows COLORREF with alpha (0xAABBGGRR) to System.Drawing.Color.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Color_.ColorFromBGR(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts from native Windows COLORREF without alpha (0x00BBGGRR) to opaque System.Drawing.Color. The alpha byte of the color argument can be 0 or any other value. Makes it 0xFF.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Color_.ColorFromARGB(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts from ARGB uint (0xAARRGGBB) to System.Drawing.Color. Same as but don't need unchecked((int)0xFF...).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Color_.ColorFromRGB(System.UInt32)
member.summary: Converts from RGB uint (0x00RRGGBB) to opaque System.Drawing.Color. Same as but don't need to specify alpha. You can replace Color.FromArgb(unchecked((int)0xFF123456)) with Color_.ColorFromRGB(0x123456).

member.name: M:Catkeys.Color_.ColorFromNameOrRGB(System.String,System.Drawing.Color@)
member.summary: Converts string to opaque System.Drawing.Color. The string can be a color name () or 0xRRGGBB. Returns false if invalid name.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Output.Warning(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes a string prefixed with "Warning: " and optionally followed by the stack trace.
member.param: Warning text.
If >= 0, appends stack trace, skipping this number of frames.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Output.Writer
member.summary: Gets or sets object that actually writes text when your script or the automation library calls Output.Write or Write. If you want to redirect or modify output text (for example write to a file or add time), use code like this: Output.Writer=myWriter;, where myWriter is a variable of your class that is derived from TextWriter and overrides its functions WriteLine, Write and Encoding. It is like redirecting console output with code Console.SetOut(myWriter); (see ). Usually the best place to redirect is in static ScriptClass() { }. Redirection is applied to whole script appdomain, and does not affect other scripts. Redirection affects Write, RedirectConsoleOutput, RedirectDebugOutput, AlwaysOutput and all OutX. It does not affect WriteDirectly and Clear. Don't call Output.Write and Write in your writer class; it would create stack overflow; if need, use Output.WriteDirectly.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Output.WriteDirectly(System.String)
member.summary: Writes string value to the output or console. Unlike other Write methods, this function ignores custom Writer used to redirect output, therefore can be used in your custom writer class.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Output.RedirectConsoleOutput
member.summary: Let Console.WriteX methods write to the output, unless this is a console process (even if AlwaysOutput is true). Console.Write will write line, like Console.WriteLine. Note: Console.Clear will not clear output; it will throw exception; use Output.Clear or try/catch.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Output.RedirectDebugOutput
member.summary: Let Debug.WriteX and Trace.WriteX methods write to the output or console. To write to the output even in console process, set Output.AlwaysOutput=true; before calling this method first time.
