member.name: M:Catkeys.Wnd.FromXY(Catkeys.Types{System.Int32,System.Single},Catkeys.Types{System.Int32,System.Single},System.Nullable{System.Boolean},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets visible top-level window or control from point. By default the coordinates are relative to the primary screen.
member.param: X coordinate. Can be int (pixels) or float (fraction of primary screen or its work area).
Y coordinate. Can be int (pixels) or float (fraction of primary screen or its work area).

true if you need a control (child window); returns Wnd0 if there is no control at that point. false if you need top-level window; if at that point is a control, gets its top-level parent. If omitted or null, gets exactly what is at that point (control or top-level window).
The coordinates are relative to the work area.
member.remarks:
Alternatively can be used API WindowFromPoint, ChildWindowFromPoint, ChildWindowFromPointEx or RealChildWindowFromPoint, but all they have various limitations and are not very useful in automation scripts. For example, this function:
Gets non-transparent controls that are behind (in the Z order) transparent controls (group button, tab control etc). Supports more control types than RealChildWindowFromPoint.
Does not skip disabled controls.
Can get only top-level window or only control or any.
Supports fractional coordinates.
Supports work area coordinates.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Wnd._WindowsStoreAppFrameChild(Catkeys.Wnd)
member.summary: On Win10+, if w is "ApplicationFrameWindow", returns the real app window "Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow" hosted by w. If w is minimized, cloaked (eg on other desktop) or the app is starting, the "Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow" is not its child. Then searches for a top-level window with the same name as of w. It is unreliable, but MS does not provide API for this. Info: "Windows.UI.Core.CoreWindow" windows hosted by "ApplicationFrameWindow" belong to separate processes. All "ApplicationFrameWindow" windows belong to a single process.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.FindParams.ProcessId
member.summary: Sets process id. If programEtc was used, clears it. If value is 0, does not clear program name.

example.code: Wnd w = Wnd.Find("*- Notepad", "Notepad"); if(w.Is0) { Wnd.LastFindParams.ProcessId = Shell.Run("notepad.exe"); w = WaitFor.WindowActive(Wnd.LastFindParams); }

member.name: M:Catkeys.Wnd.Find(System.String,System.String,System.Object,Catkeys.WFFlags,System.Func{Catkeys.Wnd,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Finds window. Returns its handle as Wnd. Returns Wnd0 if not found.
member.param: Window name. Usually it is the title bar text. String format: wildcard expression. null means 'any', "" means 'no name'.
Window class name. String format: wildcard expression. null means 'any'.

Depends on type and flags:
null - any (this parameter is not used).
string - program file name without ".exe". String format: wildcard expression.
Wnd - owner window. See .
int, uint - process id. If using flag ThreadId - native thread id (not Thread.ManagedThreadId). See , , , , , GetProcessId or GetThreadId.
Lambda etc callback function to call for each matching window. It can evaluate more properties of the window and return true when they match. Example: also: t => t.HasStyle(Native.WS_CAPTION).
member.remarks: If there are multiple matching windows, gets the first in the Z order matching window, preferring visible windows. On Windows 8 and later finds only desktop windows, not Windows Store app Metro-style windows (on Windows 10 only few such windows exist), unless this process has uiAccess; to find such windows you can use FindFast.
member.exception: className is "". To match any, use null. programEtc is "" or 0. To match any, use null. programEtc argument type is not string/Wnd/int/uint/null. Invalid wildcard expression ("**options|" or regular expression).

example.code: Wnd w=Wnd.Find("Name"); if(w.Is0) Print("not found");

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.LastFindParams
member.summary: Gets arguments of this thread's last call to or , which set it before returning, regardless of results.
member.remarks: WaitFor.WindowActive and similar functions don't change this property. But this property is often used with them, like in the example.

example.code: Wnd w = Wnd.Find("*- Notepad", "Notepad"); if(w.Is0) { Shell.Run("notepad.exe"); w = WaitFor.WindowActive(Wnd.LastFindParams); }

member.name: M:Catkeys.Wnd.FindAll(System.String,System.String,System.Object,Catkeys.WFFlags,System.Func{Catkeys.Wnd,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Finds all matching windows. Returns list containing 0 or more window handles as Wnd. Everything except the return type is the same as with .
member.remarks: The list is sorted to match the Z order, however hidden windows (when using WFFlags.HiddenToo) are always after visible windows.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Wnd.FindFast(System.String,System.String,Catkeys.Wnd)
member.summary: Finds window. Returns its handle as Wnd. Returns Wnd0 if not found. Calls API FindWindowEx. Faster than Find, which uses API EnumWindows. Can be used only when you know full name and/or class name. Finds hidden windows too.
member.param: Name. Can be null to match any. Full, case-insensitive. Wildcard etc not supported.
Class name. Can be null to match any. Cannot be "". Full, case-insensitive. Wildcard etc not supported.
If used, starts searching from the next window in the Z order.
member.remarks: It is not recommended to use this function in a loop to enumerate windows. It would be unreliable because window positions in the Z order can be changed while enumerating. Also then it would be slower than Find and FindAll. Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndOwner
member.summary: Gets or sets the owner window of this top-level window. A window that has an owner window is always on top of its owner window. Don't call this for controls, they don't have an owner window. The 'get' function supports . The 'set' function can fail, eg if the owner's process has higher UAC integrity level.
member.exception: Failed (only 'set' function).

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndWindow
member.summary: Gets the top-level parent window of this control. If this is a top-level window, returns this window. Calls API GetAncestor(GA_ROOT).

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.IsChildWindow
member.summary: Returns true if this is a child window (control), false if top-level window.
member.remarks: Supports . Uses . Another way is w.HasStyle(Native.WS_CHILD). It is faster but less reliable, because some top-level windows have WS_CHILD style and some child windows don't.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Wnd.IsChildOf(Catkeys.Wnd)
member.summary: Returns true if this is a direct or indirect child (descendant) of window w. Calls API IsChild.
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndDirectParent
member.summary: Gets the window or control that is the direct parent of this control. Returns Wnd0 (0) if this is a top-level window. If need top-level parent window, use .
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndDirectParentOrOwner
member.summary: Gets the window or control that is the direct parent of this control or owner of this top-level window. Calls API GetParent. Faster than .
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndFirstSibling
member.summary: Gets the window of the same type that is highest in the Z order. If this is a top-level window, gets first top-level window, else gets first control of the same direct parent. If this is the first, returns this, not Wnd0. Calls API GetWindow(this, GW_HWNDFIRST).
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndLastSibling
member.summary: Gets the window of the same type that is lowest in the Z order. If this is a top-level window, gets last top-level window, else gets last control of the same direct parent. If this is the last, returns this, not Wnd0. Calls API GetWindow(this, GW_HWNDLAST).
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndNext
member.summary: Gets the window of the same type that is next (below this) in the Z order. If this is a top-level window, gets next top-level window, else gets next control of the same direct parent. If this is the last, returns Wnd0. Calls API GetWindow(this, GW_HWNDNEXT).
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndPrev
member.summary: Gets the window of the same type that is previous (above this) in the Z order. If this is a top-level window, gets previous top-level window, else gets previous control of the same direct parent. If this is the first, returns Wnd0. Calls API GetWindow(this, GW_HWNDPREV).
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndFirstChild
member.summary: Gets the child control at the top of the Z order. Returns Wnd0 if no children. The same as WndChild(0). Calls API GetWindow(this, GW_CHILD).
member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Wnd.WndLastChild

member.remarks: Supports .

member.name: M:Catkeys.Wnd.WndNextMain(System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets next window in the Z order, skipping invisible and other windows that would not be added to taskbar or not activated by Alt+Tab. Returns Wnd0 if there are no such windows. If this is Wnd0, starts from the top of the Z order.
member.param: If this is not Wnd0 and there are no matching windows after it, retry from the top of the Z order. Like Alt+Tab does. Can return wFrom.
Skip minimized windows.
On Windows 10 include windows on all virtual desktops. On Windows 8 include Windows Store apps (only if this process has UAC integrity level uiAccess).

Emulate Alt+Tab behavior with owned windows (message boxes, dialogs): If this is such owned window, skip its owner. If the found window has an owned window that was active more recently, return that owned window.
member.remarks: This function is quite slow and does not exactly match the behavior of the Windows taskbar and Alt+Tab.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Registry_.ParseKeyString(System.String@)
member.summary: Parses registry key string and returns hive as RegistryKey. If key starts with "HKEY_", removes hive name from it and returns that hive. For example, if key is @"HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Test", sets key=@"Software\Test" and returns Registry.LocalMachine. Else if key is null or @"\", sets key=Registry_.CatkeysKey (@"Software\Catkeys\User") and returns Registry.CurrentUser. Else if key starts with @"\", prepends Registry_.CatkeysKey (@"Software\Catkeys\User") and returns Registry.CurrentUser. Else just returns Registry.CurrentUser. Valid hive names: "HKEY_CURRENT_USER", "HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE", "HKEY_CLASSES_ROOT", "HKEY_USERS", "HKEY_PERFORMANCE_DATA" or "HKEY_CURRENT_CONFIG".
member.param: Registry key. Can start with a hive name.
member.exception: 'key' starts with "HKEY_" but it is an invalid hive name.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.SharedMemory.CreateOrGet(System.String,System.UInt32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Creates named shared memory of specified size. If already exists, just gets its address. Returns shared memory address in this process. Calls API CreateFileMapping and API MapViewOfFile.
member.param: Shared memory name. Case-insensitive.
Shared memory size. The function uses it only when creating the memory; it does not check whether the size argument matches the size of existing memory.
Allow UAC low-integrity-level processes to access the shared memory.
member.exception: The API failed.
member.remarks: Once the memory is created, it is alive at least until this process ends. Other processes can keep the memory alive even after that. There is no Close function to close the native shared memory object handle. The OS closes it when this process ends.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Util.LibProcessMemory
member.summary: Memory shared by all appdomains of current process. Size 0x10000 (64 KB). Initially zero.
member.remarks: When need to prevent simultaneous access of the memory by multiple threads, use lock("uniqueString"){...} . It locks in all appdomains, because literal strings are interned, ie shared by all appdomains. Using some other object with 'lock' would lock only in that appdomain. However use this only in single module, because ngened modules have own interned strings.

Receives buffer pointer.
If fails to allocate, return false and don't throw exception.

member.exception: Failed. Probably size is too big.

member.summary: Thread pool where COM can be used. Initializes thread COM as single-thread-apartment.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.WorkCallbackData
member.summary: Work callback function parameter type. More info: .

member.name: T:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.WorkCallback
member.summary: Work callback function type.
member.param: Contains state and completionCallback that were passed to the submit function. Your work callback function can change completionCallback and/or state. For example it can set completionCallback = null to prevent calling it (the call is expensive); or change state, if want to pass another object to the completion function. Note that the completion function is never called if initially it was null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.SubmitCallback(System.Object,Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.WorkCallback,System.Threading.SendOrPostCallback)
member.summary: Requests that a thread pool thread call the callback function.
member.param: Something to pass to the callback functions.
Callback function to call in a thread pool thread.
Optional callback function to call in this thread after workCallback.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.CreateWork(System.Object,Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.WorkCallback,System.Threading.SendOrPostCallback)
member.summary: Creates a object that can be used when need more options than SubmitCallback has.
member.param: Something to pass to the callback functions.
Callback function to call in a thread pool thread.
Optional callback function to call in this thread after workCallback.
member.remarks: Call Dispose() to avoid memory leaks. If not called, the object and related OS object remain in memory until this appdomain ends.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.Work
member.summary: Allows to submit a callback function (one or more times) to be called in thread pool threads, then optionally wait and cancel. Can be used when need more options than SubmitCallback has.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.Work.Submit
member.summary: Requests that a thread pool thread call the callback function. This function can be called multiple times.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.Work.Wait
member.summary: Waits until all submitted instances of the callback function finish their work. While waiting, this thread cannot dispatch events and Windows messages.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.Work.Cancel
member.summary: Waits until all running instances of the callback function finish their work, and cancels pending (still not running) instances. While waiting, this thread cannot dispatch events and Windows messages.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.ThreadPoolSTA.Work.Dispose
member.summary: Calls , releases all resources used by this object and allows this object to be garbage-collected. Call this to avoid memory leaks. If not called, the object and related OS object remain in memory until this appdomain ends.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Util.TypeSize`1
member.summary: Gets managed run-time size of type T. Works with any type. Works in generic classes too. Unlike sizeof, gets run-time size. Eg for IntPtr and reference types gets 4 or 8. Unlike Marshal.SizeOf, gets managed type size (eg 1 for bool), not native type size (eg 4 for bool). Example: Print(Catkeys.Util.TypeSize<T>.Size);.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Util.LibWorkarounds.WaitCursorWhenShowingMenuEtc
member.summary: A workaround for: When showing a ContextMenuStrip menu or a submenu, something briefly sets the AppStarting cursor. Only if this process does/did not have active windows. Only if current cursor is arrow. Works well if eg I or hand. Starts before first WM_NCPAINT (after WM_SHOWWINDOW+WM_WINDOWPOSCHANGING) and stops before WM_PAINT. Call this before showing a menu. Possibly also will need for some other windows.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Util.LibActCtx
member.summary: Activates our manifest which tells to use comctl32.dll version 6. The manifest is embedded in this dll, resource id 2. This code is from .NET MessageBox.Show.

member.name: T:Catkeys.WaitFor
member.summary: Provides functions to wait for a condition, such as 'window exists'.
member.remarks:
All functions have a timeoutS parameter. It is the maximal time to wait, in seconds. If it is 0, waits indefinitely. If >0, after timeoutS time throws . If <0, after -timeoutS time just stops waiting and returns default value (false, Wnd0, etc).
While waiting, messages and events are not processed. For example, if used in a Form/Control event handler, the form would stop responding. Then need to use another thread, for example async/await/Task, like in the example.

member.name: T:Catkeys.WaitFor._Timeout
member.summary: Can be used to easily implement timeout in wait-for functions. See how it is used eg in WindowExists.

member.name: F:Catkeys.WaitFor._Timeout.Period
member.summary: Current period. Initially it is constructor->initPeriod (default 10). The Sleep method increments it until reached MaxPeriod.

member.name: F:Catkeys.WaitFor._Timeout.MaxPeriod
member.summary: Maximal period. It is constructor->maxPeriod (default 200).

member.name: M:Catkeys.WaitFor._Timeout.IsTimeout
member.summary: If the timeout is not expired, returns false. Else if constructor->timeoutS was negative, returns true. Else throws TimeoutException. Also gets current time and updates private fields, if need.

member.name: M:Catkeys.WaitFor._Timeout.Sleep
member.summary: If IsTimeout(), returns false. Else sleeps for Period milliseconds, increments Period if it is less than MaxPeriod, and returns true.

member.name: M:Catkeys.WaitFor.WindowExists(System.Double,System.String,System.String,System.Object,Catkeys.WFFlags,System.Func{Catkeys.Wnd,System.Boolean})
member.summary: Waits until the specified window exists (possibly invisible or inactive). Returns window handle. If timeoutS is negative, on timeout returns Wnd0 (else exception). All parameters etc are the same as .
member.param: The maximal time to wait, in seconds. If 0, waits indefinitely. If >0, after timeoutS time throws TimeoutException. If <0, after -timeoutS time returns Wnd0.
member.exception: timeoutS time has expired.
Exceptions of .

member.summary: The same as overload , just arguments are passed differently.
member.param: Window properties etc.
member.exception: timeoutS time has expired.

member.exception: timeoutS time has expired.

member.summary: Waits until the window is active. Returns true. If timeoutS is negative, on timeout returns false (else exception).
member.param: An existing window.
The maximal time to wait, in seconds. If 0, waits indefinitely. If >0, after timeoutS time throws TimeoutException. If <0, after -timeoutS time returns false.
member.exception: timeoutS time has expired.
w is invalid or the window was closed while waiting.

member.name: M:Catkeys.WaitFor.WindowCondition(Catkeys.Wnd,System.Func{Catkeys.Wnd,System.Boolean},System.Double,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Waits for an user-defined condition of an existing window. Returns true. If timeoutS is negative, on timeout returns false (else exception).
member.param: The maximal time to wait, in seconds. If 0, waits indefinitely. If >0, after timeoutS time throws TimeoutException. If <0, after -timeoutS time returns false.
An existing window. It is passed to the callback function.
Callback function (eg lambda). It is called repeatedly, until returns true.

Do not throw exception if w is invalid or the window was closed while waiting. Also then the callback function must return true when is false. Else the exception is thrown (with a small delay) to prevent infinite waiting.
member.exception: timeoutS time has expired.
w is invalid or the window was closed while waiting.

member.name: M:Catkeys.WaitFor.Condition(System.Double,System.Func{System.Object,System.Boolean},System.Object,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Waits for an user-defined condition. Returns true. If timeoutS is negative, on timeout returns false (else exception).
member.param: The maximal time to wait, in seconds. If 0, waits indefinitely. If >0, after timeoutS time throws TimeoutException. If <0, after -timeoutS time returns false.
Callback function (eg lambda). It is called repeatedly, until returns true.
Something to pass to the callback function.
The initial period of calling the callback function, in milliseconds.

The maximal period of calling the callback function, in milliseconds. The period is incremented by 1 millisecond in each loop until it reaches maxPeriod. It gives a good response time initially, and small CPU usage after some time.
member.exception: timeoutS time has expired.
minPeriod < 1 or maxPeriod < minPeriod.
Exceptions thrown by the condition callback function.

member.name: T:Catkeys.WFFlags
member.summary: 'flags' parameter of .

member.name: F:Catkeys.WFFlags.HiddenToo
member.summary: Can find hidden windows. Use this carefully, always use className, not just name, because there are many hidden tooltip windows etc that could match the name.

member.name: F:Catkeys.WFFlags.SkipCloaked
member.summary: Skip cloaked windows. These are windows hidden not in the classic way (Wnd.IsVisible does not detect it, Wnd.Cloaked detects). For example, windows on inactive Windows 10 virtual desktops, hidden Windows Store apps on Windows 8.

member.name: F:Catkeys.WFFlags.ThreadId
member.summary: The 'programEtc' argument is thread id, not process id. Alternatively use , it's faster.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Icons.IconFlags.LiteralPath
member.summary: The 'file' argument is literal full path. Don't parse "path,index", don't support ".ext" (file type icon), don't make fully-qualified, etc.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Icons.IconFlags.SearchPath
member.summary: If file is not full path, call Files.SearchPath. Without this flag searches only in ; with this flag also searches there first.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.GetFileIconImage(System.String,System.Int32,Catkeys.Icons.IconFlags)
member.summary: Gets file icon. Extracts icon directly from the file, or gets shell icon, depending on file type, icon index, flags etc. Calls and converts to Bitmap. Returns null if failed, for example if the file does not exist. Later call Dispose().
member.param: Can be: Path of any file or folder. URL, like "http://..." or "mailto:a@b.c" or "file:///path". ITEMIDLIST like ":: HexEncodedITEMIDLIST". It can be of any file, folder, URL or virtual object like Control Panel. See . Shell object parsing name, like @"::{CLSID-1}\::{CLSID-2}" or "shell:AppsFolder\WinStoreAppId". File type like ".txt" or URL protocol like "http:". If it is a file containing multiple icons (eg exe, dll), can be specified icon index like "path,index" or native icon resource id like "path,-id". If not full path, the function will look in . Supports environment variables (see ).
Icon width and height. Also can be enum , cast to int.

member.name: F:Catkeys.Icons.ShellSize.SysSmall
member.summary: Icons displayed in window title bar and system notification area (tray). Usually 16x16 when normal DPI, the same as Small.

member.summary: Small icons displayed in Explorer folders. Usually 16x16 when normal DPI.

member.summary: Large icons displayed in Explorer folders. Usually 32x32 when normal DPI.

member.summary: 256x256 icons displayed in Explorer folders.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.GetShellIconSize(Catkeys.Icons.ShellSize)
member.summary: Gets the width and height of shell icons of standard sizes - small, large, extra large and jumbo. Jumbo is always 256. Others depend on text size (DPI) that can be changed in Control Panel. If text size is 100%, they usually are 16, 32, 48.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.GetFileIconHandleRaw(System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Extracts icon directly from file that contains it. Returns icon handle. Returns Zero if failed. Later call or .
member.param: .ico, .exe, .dll or other file that contains one or more icons. Also supports cursor files - .cur, .ani. Must be full path, without icon index. Supports environment variables (see ).
Icon index or negative icon resource id in the .exe/.dll file.
Icon width and height. Also can be enum , cast to int.

Icon width and height. Also can be enum , cast to int.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.GetAppIconHandle(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the first native icon handle of the entry assembly of current appdomain. Returns Zero if there are no icons. It is not an icon from managed resources. The icon is cached and protected from destroying, therefore don't need to destroy it, and not error to do it.
member.param: Icon width and height. Also can be enum , cast to int.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.GetProcessExeIconHandle(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the first native icon handle of the program file of this process. Returns Zero if there are no icons. It is not an icon from managed resources. The icon is cached and protected from destroying, therefore don't need to destroy it, and not error to do it.
member.param: Icon width and height. Also can be enum , cast to int.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.DestroyIconHandle(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Destroys native icon. Calls API DestroyIcon. Does nothing if iconHandle is Zero.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.ParseIconLocation(System.String@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Parses icon location string. Returns true if it includes icon index or resource id.

Receives the number or 0.
member.remarks: Also supports path enclosed in double quotes like "\"path\",index", and spaces between comma and index like "path, index".

member.summary: For .
member.param: Contains icon Image or handle, as well as the input parameters.
objCommon passed to GetAllAsync.
How many icons is still to get. Eg 0 if this is the last icon.

member.name: T:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons
member.summary: Gets file icons asynchronously. Use to avoid waiting until all icons are extracted before displaying them in a UI (menu etc). Instead you show the UI without icons, and then asynchronously receive icons when they are extracted. At first call for each file. Then call GetAllAsync. Create a callback function of type and pass its delegate to GetAllAsync.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.Add(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a file path to an internal collection.
member.param: File path etc to pass to .
Something to pass to your callback function together with icon handle for this file.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.Add(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIn})
member.summary: Adds multiple file paths to an internal collection. The same as calling Add(string, object) multiple times. This function copies the list.

member.name: P:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of items added with Add(). GetAllAsync() sets it = 0.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.GetAllAsync(Catkeys.Icons.AsyncCallback,System.Int32,Catkeys.Icons.IconFlags,System.Object)
member.summary: Starts getting icons of files added with Add(). After this function returns, icons are asynchronously extracted with , and callback called with icon handle (or Zero if failed). The callback is called in this thread. This thread must have a message loop (eg Application.Run()). If you'll need more icons, you can call Add() and GetAllAsync() again with the same AsyncIcons instance, even if getting old icons if still not finished.
member.param: A callback function delegate.
Icon width and height. Also can be enum , cast to int.
Something to pass to callback functions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.Clear
member.summary: Clears the internal collection of file paths added with Add().

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.Cancel
member.summary: Stops getting icons and calling callback functions.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.AsyncIcons.Dispose
member.summary: Calls .

member.summary: Gets file icons. Uses 2-level cache - memory and file.
member.remarks: Can be used as static variables.

member.summary: Remembers cacheFile and iconSize.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.FileIconCache.Dispose
member.summary: Calls .

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.FileIconCache.SaveCacheFileNow
member.summary: Saves to the cache file now, if need. Don't need to call this explicitly. It is called by Dispose.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.FileIconCache.ClearCache
member.summary: Clears the memory cache and deletes the cache file.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Icons.FileIconCache.GetImage(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Gets file icon as Bitmap. If it is in the memory cache, gets it from there. Else if it is in the file cache, gets it from there and adds to the memory cache. Else gets from file (uses and adds to the file cache and to the memory cache. Returns null if GetFileIconImage failed, eg file does not exist.
member.param: Any file or folder.

Get file type icon, depending on filename extension. Use this to avoid getting separate image object for each file of same type. This is ignored if filename extension is ".ico" or ".exe" or starts with ".exe," or ".dll,".
member.remarks: Thread-safe. The variable can be static, and this function can be called from any thread without locking.

member.summary: Copies all options from another ScriptOptions object.
member.param: If null, sets speed = 100 and other members = false/0/null.

member.name: M:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.Copy
member.summary: Creates new object with all the same option values. Code var o2=o1.Copy(); does the same as var o2=new ScriptOptions(o1); .

member.name: P:Catkeys.ScriptOptions.Default
member.summary: Default options used by: All threads of current script's appdomain; New ScriptOptions objects created like var o=new ScriptOptions();. Initially default speed is 100, other options false/0/null. You can modify them in scripts and script templates. Do it in ScriptClass static constructor.

example.code: static ScriptClass() { ScriptOptions.Default.speed=50; } //constructor ... Print(Option.speed); //speed of this thread Option.speed=10; //changes only for this thread

member.summary: Code speed measurement. Easier to use than System.Stopwatch class. Stores data in shared memory, therefore works across appdomains.

member.param: Call .

member.name: P:Catkeys.Perf.Inst.Incremental
member.summary: If true, times of each new First/Next/Next... measurement are added to previous measurement times. Finally you can call Write() or Times to get the sums. Usually used to measure code in loops. See example.

member.summary: Stores current time in next element of an internal array. Don't call Next() more than 16 times after First(), because the array has fixed size.

member.summary: Formats a string from time values collected by calling First() and Next(), and shows it in the output. The string contains the number of microseconds of each code execution between calling First() and each Next().

member.summary: If true, times of each new First/Next/Next... measurement are added to previous measurement times. Finally you can call Write() or Times to get the sums. Usually used to measure code in loops. See example.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Perf.Write
member.summary: Formats a string from time values collected by calling First() and Next(), and shows it in the output. The string contains the number of microseconds of each code execution between calling First() and each Next(). Example: Perf.First(100); CODE1; Perf.Next(); CODE2; Perf.Next(); Perf.Write(); //speed: timeOfCODE1 timeOfCODE2.

member.name: M:Catkeys.Perf.SpinCPU(System.Int32,System.Action[])
member.summary: Repeatedly executes codes (zero or more lambda functions) timeMS milliseconds (recommended 100 or more). Can be called before measuring code speed, because after some idle time CPU may need to work for some time to gain full speed.
